item.title: #FREESZASZA URGENT ACTION STEPS ...
item.content:encoded:
#FREESZASZA URGENT ACTION STEPS

Join us in calling and emailing, Ice Deputy Assistant Director, Jeffrey Lynch,
720- 873-2899

Jeffrey.d.lynch@ice.dhs.gov/Jeff.d.lynch@ice.dhs.gov

Collective Call-In Action 9/10 @ 10am- 12pm MT/ 9am- 11am PST/ 11am- 1pm EST
Script Provided

As you may know, Sza Sza Codner or Jennifer Codner is a Jamaican trans woman detained at Aurora Contract Detention Facility.

Sza Sza endured violence and persecution in her country of origin which drove her to seek asylum and refuge here. Since then she's been ferried from one immigrant prison to the other, subjected to solitary confinement, targeting and harassment from guards, placed in men's facilities, and a host of other horrible atrocities.
Help end her indefinite imprisonment by pushing for her release.

Sza Sza has court this Friday, 9/11 and we are determined to assist in getting her out of detention and towards safety.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: From her mother: Tania arrived to Denver when she was six years...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

From her mother: Tania arrived to Denver when she was six years old. She‚Äôs a DACA recipient, has made a family here, and is now a social worker at Vega Collegiate Academy. With her family she‚Äôs forming a catering business and is applying for her residency through her husband, who is a citizen. All while attending college. She has three children and the legal costs for her case are high. Since she arrived to the U.S. at six years old she‚Äôs been fighting for labor, civil, and h...uman rights alongside her mother. She‚Äôs been fighting for immigrant justice for 13 years.

De su mam√°: Tania llego a los 6 a√±os de edad a Denver ella es una DACA program a formado su familia y ahora trabaja como trabajadora social en la escuela la vega y junto a su familia est√°n creando su negocio de caterin y est√° aplicando por su residencia a trav√©s de su esposo ciudadano y al mismo tiempo sigue estudiando tiene 3 ni√±os y los costos legales son altos ella desde los 6 a√±os que lleg√≥ luch√≥ junto a su mam√° por derechos laborales, civiles y humanos y por 13 a√±os por derechos de inmigrantes.

item.title: "The local Somali community, for example, was getting its...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The local Somali community, for example, was getting its COVID-19 information from social media channels based in Somalia and in Minneapolis, where the U.S.‚Äôs largest concentration of Somalis live. And while that information was not necessarily wrong, it was not Colorado-specific. So, the Welcome Center turned to its community outreach workers and partners and translators and ‚Äúwe went to our website and created a page to put COVID information in 18 languages and we were upda...ting it daily, with whatever new information was coming out,‚Äù Higuera says. They did something similar on the center‚Äôs Facebook page, using video and expanding the range of information [...]

A larger conversation is happening among journalists and the public around coverage of communities that long have gone uncovered or not been covered well, the result of ignorance or arrogance, of newsroom blind spots and deaf ears, of the subjectivity that disguises itself as objectivity in largely white newsrooms. That conversation, reflective, earnest, defensive at times, angry and anguished at others, is a reckoning. It is a call to do better inside newsrooms and outside them by better connecting to the communities we cover."

See MoreCOLab's Tina Griego writes of Rocky Mountain Welcome Center's efforts to become an info hub for refugees and immigrants in the COVID age.

coloradoindependent.com

Hungering for news in refugee and immigrant communities

COLab's Tina Griego writes of Rocky Mountain Welcome Center's efforts to become an info hub for refugees and immigrants in the COVID age.COLab's Tina Griego writes of Rocky Mountain Welcome Center's efforts to become an info hub for refugees and immigrants in the COVID age.

item.title: Abolish ICE Denver+16XucanistaNi Una Menos Cdmx, a feminist collective in Mexico City, has taken over and are occupying the National Human...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver+16Xucanista

Ni Una Menos Cdmx, a feminist collective in Mexico City, has taken over and are occupying the National Human Rights Commission and have turned it into a shelter... for victims of gender-based violence..

Yesenia Zamudio, whose speech about her daughter who was murdered that went viral earlier this year, is member and stated that they will not hand the building over. ‚ÄúWere more suitable for these premises than the parasitic people who were here before.

TW: ‚ùå‚ùå Femicide

In Mexico, average of 10 women are killed every day. In 2019, 3,833 women were killed. Reports show that number has jumped in 2020. Women are even more vulnerable due to pandemic.

All photos by Andrea Murcia.

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: LIVE AT ICE HEADQUARTERS: Trump's new ICE Director is Tony...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

LIVE AT ICE HEADQUARTERS:

Trump's new ICE Director is Tony Pham, a man who *himself* came to the U.S. as a refugee. Instead of helping others in need to find the same safety he received, ICE Director Pham has been complicit in ICE's abuse of immigrants and refugees. He is allowing himself to be used as propaganda to demonstrate that immigrants should come "the right way" when in reality- the system is backlogged to 1997.

That's why immigrant and refugees are at ICE Headquarters now-calling out Pham's empty values and Trump's cruelty.

VietRISE was live.

PRESS CONFERENCE: Refugee Communities Joint Statement to New Head of ICE, Tony Pham

FANM, Central American Resource Center (CARECEN-LA), National Day Laborer Organizing Network, SEAC Village, VietLead, Charlotte Uprising, Comunidad Colectiva
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: üöêüß°‚úä ¬°Casa de Paz ahora tiene una camioneta de...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

üöêüß°‚úä

¬°Casa de Paz ahora tiene una camioneta de bienvenida para personas que est√°n siendo liberadas por GEO!

Casa de Paz

We‚Äôre excited to introduce you to our Immigrant Welcome Center on Wheels!

This converted van will be parked outside the ICE immigrant detention center and be a... soft landing place for folks being released. We‚Äôll be there within minutes to give them a warm welcome to the US and accompany them as they begin making their way home to reunite with their families.

Our Immigrant Welcome Center on Wheels is a promise - a promise that as long as detention centers keep families apart, there will also be a welcome center (that just happens to look a whole lot like a van) for those who need us.

But this is more than just a van. This is a van of hope. A van of peace. A van of welcome.

Learn more here: https://www.casadepazcolorado.org/welcome-on-wheels

Jess Wiederholt

Our Buddhist Grandma was arrested last night steps away from her home in Denver. I have been serving alongside this beautiful soul during marches and protests a...nd service to our houseless neighbors. She is the real thing!

She was alone, and then surrounded by at least 15 DPD officers. This targeting, intimidation, and arrest of a non violent protester using her #firstamendmentrights is a gross overstep & misuse of power!!

item.title: In 1942, facing labor shortages caused by World War II, the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

In 1942, facing labor shortages caused by World War II, the United States initiated a series of agreements with Mexico to recruit Mexican men to work on U.S. farms and railroads. Between 1942 and 1964, an estimated two million Mexican men came to the United States on short-term labor contracts through the Bracero program, named after the term used in Mexico for a manual laborer.

On #LaborDay, let us remember the Bracero Program, a key chapter in U.S. labor/immigration histor...y: http://s.si.edu/braceros

En 1942, frente a la escasez de mano de obra causada por la Segunda Guerra Mundial, Estados Unidos inici√≥ una serie de acuerdos con M√©xico para reclutar hombres mexicanos para trabajar en granjas y ferrocarriles estadounidenses. Entre 1942 y 1964, se estima que dos millones de hombres mexicanos llegaron a los Estados Unidos con contratos laborales a corto plazo a trav√©s del programa Bracero, llamado as√≠ por el t√©rmino utilizado en M√©xico para un trabajador manual.

Hoy en #LaborDay, recordamos el Programa Bracero, un cap√≠tulo clave en la historia laboral / migratoria de Estados Unidos: http://s.si.edu/braceros

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement...
item.content:encoded:
Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) was planning an operation to target thousands of immigrant families that have received final deportation orders- a carefully coordinated push that was to target on up to 10 "sanctuary" cities across the country.

Many of us in the Coalition to Close the Concentation Camps knew that it was time to take action against forces of fascism and evil- especially for our families impacted by this broken immigration system. On July 12, 2019, radicals and impacted families split from the milquetoast Lights for Liberty vigil being conducted at the Aurora ICE Processing Center. Rebels marched into the parking lot of GEO- where anticolonial speeches were given by indigenous youth and where the now infamous flag removal occurred.

Following the flag removal and international embarrassment, the Aurora Police Department began a Twitter manhunt offering a $4k reward to identify suspects from that evening; violent crimes typically only get a $1k reward and we knew this outrageously large reward was made because two anti police flags were flown that night. Cowards at APD wouldn't fire or prosecute the murderers of Elijah McClain the following month, yet APD had the time and resources to target non-violent protestors demanding justice for immigrants.

The woman featured in this powerful photo, Michelle, was eventually identified by non profit "allies" and served misdemeanor tampering charges; Michelle's case with Aurora dragged on for over a year. Today we have some good news: our hero was found NOT GUILTY by jury trial and walks free of all charges! Fuck APD!

Michelle- you are an inspiration and a true Chingona. With you, our city sent a message to the Department of Homeland Security. Your bravery, in addition to the life Willem Van Spronsen gave on July 13th 2019 by setting ICE's kidnapping vans in Tacoma ablaze, made ICE retreat on their planned nationwide mass arrests of immigrants.

#ChingaLaMigra #AbolishICE
Photo by @buffalo_heart_images
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the...
item.content:encoded:
"All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the authority to transfer us immediately if we want," says Jimmy Sodhi, a 45-year-old ICE detainee.

Sodhi is part of a group of eight ICE detainees who have been housed in the same dormitory at the Teller County Jail since being transferred there from the Aurora Contract Detention Facility one month ago. Sodhi and the other ICE detainees began the hunger strike on the morning of August 10 to protest what they allege are significantly worse conditions at Aurora GEO.

"As a Sikh, I'm not allowed to wear my Sikh bracelet, I'm not allowed to cover my head. If I have to pray, it's required for me to cover my head. I'm told to cover my head with a pillowcase or a towel," says Sodhi, who has been in ICE custody since March 2017 and is currently in the appeals process of his deportation case stemming from a fraud conviction for insider trading. "That is very demeaning, very disrespectful."

Sodhi notes that he was allowed to wear his turban at the Aurora detention facility, but has been told by staff at the Teller County Jail that he cannot retrieve his turban from his personal belongings. Same with prayer books, Sodhi adds, which he hasn't been able to obtain, being told by staff that "there's no chaplain here and we don't have those here."

Additionally, Sodhi contends that he and other ICE detainees at the Teller County Jail have been subjected to racial harassment perpetrated by non-ICE detainees staying in the same dormitory.

[...]

Adding to his angst, Sodhi contends that he and the other detainees don't even know why they're being housed in the Teller County Jail, which has an agreement with ICE to house immigrant detainees.

Via @denverwestword @conormichael28
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are...
item.content:encoded:
Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are still in this fight for the long haul - aka until we #FreeThemAll.

Camp Free Them All has been a success in that we: saved lives, forced Aurora GEO to be one of two detention centers in the so-called United States to be offering COVID testing, forced a congressional hearing on COVID in ICE detection centers, stopped an illegal deporation, supported families with your love & money and built so much power together this summer! ‚úäüíñ

Despite these successes, we found out last week that nearly a third of the detainees are now being quarantined due to COVID and we fully intend to keep up the pressure on GEO, ICE & DHS.

Stay tuned for our next steps at Aurora GEO and if you want to help keep impacted families out of ICE custody, please donate directly to families!

Venmo: Sanctuary-4-All
Cashapp: $abolishicedenver

Tomorrow we ask that you please come get your belongings or contact us about storage. Any items not picked up will be given to unhoused neighbors and other struggles for liberation.

And please join us for a special Sunday vigil and Pablo's birthday celebration!

https://facebook.com/events/s/pablos-birthday-vigil/749228552534363/?ti=cl
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air...
item.content:encoded:
The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air Force bases and isn't doing enough to address the threat of COVID 19 facing immigrants detained at the concentration camp in his district.

GEO and ICE cannot be trusted with the care of anyone in their custody and we demand that they #FreeThemAll
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
